newsitem.title: MEXICO: Carso has 82 pct of Sears' Mexico unit.
newsitem.headline: Carso has 82 pct of Sears' Mexico unit.

text.p: Mexican conglomerate Grupo Carso has accumulated around 82 percent of the share capital of Sears de Mexico, a source close to the GCarso's buyout of the store chain said Friday.
The source, who asked to remain anonymous, said Carso bought another 9.44 million shares of Sears de Mexico on June 11.
"Now Carso has around 82 percent of Sears (de Mexico), there are still around 2.2 million shares held by people who did not take part in the offer," he added.

Carso, Mexico's largest conglomerate, announced it would buy Sears Roebuck and Co's troubled Mexican operations on April 2. Sears intends to keep a 15 percent stake. Carso had been offering to buy out individual Sears de Mexico shareholders to reach an 85 percent holding.
